trans-unit.source: Create a TCP endpoint for the virtual machine
trans-unit.target: Create a TCP endpoint for the virtual machine

trans-unit.source: In order to access SQL Server from the internet, the virtual machine must have an endpoint to listen for incoming TCP communication.
trans-unit.target: In order to access SQL Server from the internet, the virtual machine must have an endpoint to listen for incoming TCP communication.

trans-unit.source: This Azure configuration step, directs incoming TCP port traffic to a TCP port that is accessible to the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: This Azure configuration step, directs incoming TCP port traffic to a TCP port that is accessible to the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If you are connecting within the same cloud service or virtual network, you do not have to create a publically accessible endpoint.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you are connecting within the same cloud service or virtual network, you do not have to create a publically accessible endpoint.

trans-unit.source: In that case, you could continue to the next step.
trans-unit.target: In that case, you could continue to the next step.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure Management Portal, click on **VIRTUAL MACHINES**.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure Management Portal, click on **VIRTUAL MACHINES**.

trans-unit.source: Click on your newly created virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Click on your newly created virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Information about your virtual machine is presented.
trans-unit.target: Information about your virtual machine is presented.

trans-unit.source: Near the top of the page, select the **ENDPOINTS** page, and then at the bottom of the page, click **ADD**.
trans-unit.target: Near the top of the page, select the **ENDPOINTS** page, and then at the bottom of the page, click **ADD**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Add an Endpoint to a Virtual Machine** page, click **Add a Stand-alone Endpoint**, and then click the Next arrow to continue.
trans-unit.target: On the **Add an Endpoint to a Virtual Machine** page, click **Add a Stand-alone Endpoint**, and then click the Next arrow to continue.

trans-unit.source: On the **Specify the details of the endpoint** page, provide the following information.
trans-unit.target: On the **Specify the details of the endpoint** page, provide the following information.

trans-unit.source: In the **NAME** box, provide a name for the endpoint.
trans-unit.target: In the **NAME** box, provide a name for the endpoint.

trans-unit.source: You may type **57500** in the **PUBLIC PORT** box.
trans-unit.target: You may type **57500** in the **PUBLIC PORT** box.

trans-unit.source: Similarly, you may type SQL Server's default listening port **1433** in the **Private Port** box.
trans-unit.target: Similarly, you may type SQL Server's default listening port **1433** in the **Private Port** box.

trans-unit.source: Note that many organizations select different port numbers to avoid malicious security attacks.
trans-unit.target: Note that many organizations select different port numbers to avoid malicious security attacks.

trans-unit.source: Click the check mark to continue.
trans-unit.target: Click the check mark to continue.
